IEML, June, 2020

About IEML

Conference

Due to the availability of big data, rapid developments of efficient algorithms and computational capacities, applications of machine learning (ML) methods are increasingly ubiquitous in sciences. Despite their remarkable predictive capabilities, many ML models remain as black boxes in terms of their interpretability, connections and validity to the scientific problems under study. In this conference, we aim to bring together multi-disciplinary researchers in natural sciences that are interested in applying ML methods to their studies to exchange ideas on the interpretability of ML methods, data and model visualizations, evaluation methods of interpretability, robustness and reliability of ML methods and models.
